description: Guide a group of autonomous explorers to the exit by assigning critical path-finding roles.
rationale: This game focuses on indirect control and strategic resource management. It targets players who enjoy puzzle-solving and logic, and it provides an excellent environment for AI agents to learn time-sensitive decision making and spatial planning.
details: A simplified version of the classic Lemmings. A stream of 10-20 tiny agents spawns from an entry point and walks in a straight line until hitting an obstacle, at which point they turn around. The player has a limited 'skill palette' to assign to any individual agent: 1. Blocker (stops others from passing), 2. Bridge Builder (creates a diagonal path upward), 3. Basher (digs horizontally through walls). The objective is to save a minimum percentage of agents by guiding them to the exit portal within a time limit. The map is represented as a 2D grid where different characters represent air, solid ground, and hazards.

game_mechanics.gravity: Agents fall if there is no solid block beneath them. Falling from too high results in death.

skills.bridge_builder: Increases vertical height by 5 units over 10 horizontal units.
skills.basher: Removes 1 unit of horizontal wall per animation frame.
skills.blocker: Static obstacle with a 5-unit radius collision box.

game_mechanics.win_condition: At least 50% of agents reaching the exit portal.
game_mechanics.lose_condition: All agents dead or timer reaching zero.

how_to_build: uv venv && uv pip install pygame-ce
how_to_play: Left-click on an agent to apply the currently selected skill. Use number keys 1-3 to switch skills. Score increases based on the number of agents saved and the time remaining. Each skill use consumes one charge from the limited inventory.
